result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric S Berg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  Defendant plead no contest to count 2 in 14CM235.  Also to Counts 2 and 3 in 15CM6.  Count 3 in 14CM235 dismissed by operation of law. Dismiss, but read in the remaining counts in those cases, and 14CM151,16CM102,15CM84 and 15CM35.  Victim notification complied with.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Priors confirmed by the court with the defendant.    Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, contrary to 947.01(1), misd. bail jumping, contrary to 946.49(10(a) and OWI 2nd with passenger <16.  346.63(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for:  14CM235.-  probation 15 days jail.  fine alc assmt and dsp.  15CM6.  2 years probation concurrent.  no alc.  AODA and rec. treatment.  DV programming if agent recommends.  Other recommendations of agent.  Attorney Poss says defendant has 35 days credit on 14CM235.  

Court ordered:  14CM235.  sentence withheld, 2 years probation.  15 days jail, Find time served.  $700.00  fine.  AODA.    Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.  Revoke DL  and IID 2 years.  DNA sample.   Credit for 35 days if revoked.

15CM6.  sentence withheld, 2 years probation. Concurrent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and reco. trt.  Subject to random testing by agent.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  CC, DV programming if agent deems it necessary.  No contact with C. H.  Obtain and maintain employmnet, commensurate with treatment needs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss. Set all cases for a plea hearing.
Status conference on August 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Covers Case No's. 15CM84, 15CM6,14CT35,14CM235 and 14CM151.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with anyone he has reason to know is a user or possessor of illegal drugs.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: the victim:  C.V.H.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  FTA for plea/sentencing.  He tried to call Attorney Poss yesterday.  STC set for 8/1 at 3 pm.

Defendant failed to appear.  SPD Paul Fredrickson was present.    DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Fredrickson states he received a VM on 6/8 from the defendant.  He tried to call him back and couldn't reach him.  DA requests warrants on his open cases.  Warrants quthorized.
Per JoAnn L. - the 6-11-15 hearing will be changed to a different date so I didn't do the NOH's for 6-11-15.

No appearance by defendant.  SPD Carly Sebion appeared specially for SPD Paul Fredrickson.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Fredrickson states he's received several VM's from the defendant that he has an emergency.  Attorney Fredrickson will provide verification as soon as he can get it to the Court.  Plea and sentencing hearing rescheduled to 6-11-15 at 2:30.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared.  Defendant FTA for plea/sentencing hearing.  According to Attorney Fredrickson the defendant is running late.  Having car trouble.  Plea/sentencing rescheduled to 6/8/15 at 1:30 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Eric S Berg

Prior: 428 Platt Street, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Eric S Berg
Current: 428 Platt Street, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 04-29-2015)
Prior: W12182 E Town House Rd, Alma Center, WI 54611

Clerked by JM:  Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson present in the courtroom.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant had no explanation as to why he didn't appear at last hearing.  Initial appearance done on 15CM6 & 15CM84 - waived reading of complaints, stood mute.  Court entered not guilty pleas and set pretrial and status dates.  Cash bond set with conditions on those 2 cases.  14CT35, 14CM151, & 14CM235 all set for status the same date as the 2015 cases.

Status conference at 06-01-2015 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 05-06-2015 10:00 am.
DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant FTA for initial appearance.  Probable cause found.  Warrant authorized.
